sn3.5:1.2: Sitting to one side, King Pasenadi of Kosala said to the Blessed One:
sn3.5:1.3: “Here, venerable sir, while I was alone in seclusion, a reflection arose in my mind thus:
sn3.5:1.4: ‘Who now protect themselves and who leave themselves unprotected?’
sn3.5:1.5: Then, venerable sir, it occurred to me:
sn3.5:1.6: ‘Those who engage in misconduct of body, speech, and mind
sn3.5:1.8: Even though a company of elephant troops may protect them, or a company of cavalry, or a company of chariot troops, or a company of infantry,
sn3.5:1.11: Because that protection is external, not internal;
sn3.5:1.13: But those who engage in good conduct of body, speech, and mind
sn3.5:1.15: Even though no company of elephant troops protects them, nor a company of cavalry, nor a company of charioteers, nor a company of infantry,
sn3.5:1.18: Because that protection is internal, not external;
sn3.5:2.1: “So it is, great king! So it is, great king!”
sn3.5:3.2: Restraint by speech is also good;
sn3.5:3.3: Good is restraint with the mind,
sn3.5:3.6: One is said to be protected. ”
